title: 道德經
source: Chinese Text Project (ctext.org) - James Legge translation

passages.en: (Loving one's self) When the people do not fear what they ought to fear, that which is their great dread will come on them.

passages.zh: 無狎其所居，無厭其所生。
passages.en: Let them not thoughtlessly indulge themselves in their ordinary life; let them not act as if weary of what that life depends on.
It is by avoiding such indulgence that such weariness does not arise.

passages.zh: 是以聖人自知不自見；自愛不自貴。
passages.en: Therefore the sage knows (these things) of himself, but does not parade (his knowledge); loves, but does not (appear to set a) value on, himself.
And thus he puts the latter alternative away and makes choice of the former.
